premortem_analysis.scenario: It is 18 months from now. What's Poppin! has failed to achieve profitability and is considering shutting down operations.

critical_business_risks.description: Infrastructure costs scale faster than revenue, particularly database and CDN costs. Year 2 projections show $17,290/month infrastructure costs, but actual costs could be 50-100% higher due to inefficient scaling, unexpected traffic spikes, or poor optimization.
critical_business_risks.failure_scenario: By Month 12, infrastructure costs reach $4,000/month instead of $2,786/month projected. User growth is strong (30,000 users) but costs consume 80% of revenue instead of projected 50%. Team spends all resources on cost optimization instead of product development. Cannot raise Series A due to poor unit economics.

impact.team_morale: Engineering team demoralized by constant firefighting
impact.investor_confidence: Unable to raise next funding round

warning_signs: Database query performance degrading despite optimization
Engineering time >30% on infrastructure vs features

mitigation_strategies.strategy: Implement aggressive cost monitoring and alerts
actions: Set up budget alerts at 10%, 50%, 90% thresholds
Commit 50% baseline capacity to 1-year reserved instances (30% savings)
Use preemptible VMs for batch processing (60-80% savings)
Redis caching for 80%+ cache hit rate
Implement aggressive image compression (70-80% size reduction)
Use Cloud CDN with long cache times
Storage tiering: Hot (30 days), Warm (90 days), Cold (1 year+)
Lazy loading for images and assets

mitigation_strategies.strategy: Plan for horizontal scaling at 50,000 users
actions: Test sharding with synthetic data at 20,000 users
Emergency cost audit and optimization sprint
Consider downgrading features or limiting free tier
Negotiate with GCP for startup credits or discounts
Explore migration to cheaper cloud provider

critical_business_risks.risk: Poor unit economics and unsustainable burn rate
critical_business_risks.description: Conversion rates fall short of projections (1-2% vs 3-5% target), CAC increases beyond $3.00, and LTV:CAC ratio drops below 3:1. Combined with infrastructure cost overruns, monthly burn rate becomes unsustainable.
critical_business_risks.failure_scenario: By Month 9, only 1.5% of free users convert to premium (vs 3-5% target). CAC increases to $4.50 due to competitive market. Monthly revenue at Month 12 is $20,000 instead of $40,000 projected. Monthly burn is $35,000 vs $23,000 projected. Seed funding depleted by Month 15 instead of Month 24. Cannot show traction for Series A.

impact.financial: Runway reduced from 24 months to 15 months
impact.product: Forced to cut features and slow development
impact.team: Unable to hire critical roles, team burnout

warning_signs: Free to paid conversion <2% for 3 consecutive months

actions: A/B test upgrade prompts and pricing pages
Free trial for premium tier (7 days)
Invest heavily in ASO (App Store Optimization)
Content marketing: City guides, event discovery tips
Referral program: 1 month free for referrals
Social proof: User testimonials and reviews
Community building: Local event organizer partnerships
Target 20% revenue from non-subscription sources by Year 2
Conduct pricing research with user interviews
Value-based pricing (events per month vs unlimited)

contingency_plan.trigger: MRR <$15,000 at Month 9 or burn rate >$30,000/month
actions: Pivot pricing strategy (raise premium to $5.99 or $6.99)
Introduce ads to premium tier (freemium+ model)
Focus exclusively on retention and conversion
Extend runway with revenue-based financing or venture debt

success_metrics: Free to paid conversion >3% by Month 6

critical_business_risks.risk: Performance degradation under load destroys user experience
critical_business_risks.description: As user base grows to 10,000+ concurrent users, database queries slow to 2-5 seconds, app becomes unusable, users churn rapidly. Poor performance during viral growth moments (local events, festival seasons) creates negative word-of-mouth.
critical_business_risks.failure_scenario: Month 8: Local music festival drives 5,000 new users in one weekend. Database queries slow from 100ms to 3,000ms. App crashes multiple times. Users abandon app and leave 1-star reviews. App Store rating drops from 4.5 to 2.8 stars. Viral growth moment becomes existential crisis. Negative press coverage.

impact.user_experience: App becomes unusable, massive churn spike
impact.reputation: Permanent damage to brand and App Store rating

warning_signs: Infrastructure alerts firing during peak traffic

actions: APM tool (New Relic or Datadog) from day 1
Real User Monitoring (RUM) for mobile app
Synthetic monitoring for critical user flows
Performance budget: <100ms p95 API, <50ms p95 DB
Redis caching for hot data (80%+ cache hit rate target)
CDN for all assets and images
Cache warming for predictable traffic patterns
Cache invalidation strategy for real-time data
Prepared statements to prevent SQL injection and improve performance
Load testing before every major release
Stress testing at 2x expected peak load
Implement circuit breakers for external APIs
Feature flags to disable heavy features under load
Disable non-critical features via feature flags
Public communication about incident and resolution
Post-mortem and corrective action plan within 48 hours

critical_business_risks.risk: Vendor lock-in with cloud provider creates cost trap
critical_business_risks.description: Deep integration with GCP-specific services (Cloud Functions, Pub/Sub, proprietary APIs) makes migration prohibitively expensive. GCP raises prices or changes terms. Unable to negotiate better pricing or switch to cheaper alternatives.
critical_business_risks.failure_scenario: Month 18: GCP announces 25% price increase for database services. Migration to AWS would require 6 engineer-months and $60,000. Stuck with higher costs. Infrastructure costs increase from $17,000/month to $21,000/month. Gross margin drops from 60% to 45%. Profitability delayed by 12+ months.

impact.financial: Forced to accept price increases, margin compression
impact.flexibility: Unable to optimize costs through multi-cloud

warning_signs: Infrastructure as Code missing or incomplete

actions: Use open standards: PostgreSQL (not Cloud SQL proprietary features)
Use Kubernetes for compute (portable across clouds)
mitigation_strategies.expected_impact: Migration possible in 2-4 weeks vs 6 months

actions: Regular dry-run migrations to test portability
Annual cost analysis: GCP vs AWS vs Azure
Prepare migration plan to use as negotiation leverage
Maintain AWS account with minimal usage
Test deployments to AWS every 6 months
Identify which services can be hybrid/multi-cloud

contingency_plan.trigger: GCP price increase >15% or unfavorable terms change
actions: Parallel run for 1 month before full cutover

critical_business_risks.risk: Lack of actionable analytics prevents optimization
critical_business_risks.description: PostHog implementation incomplete or poorly configured. Cannot track critical user behaviors, conversion funnels, or churn triggers. Making product and marketing decisions blind. Burning money on ineffective user acquisition channels.
critical_business_risks.failure_scenario: Month 6: Spending $5,000/month on user acquisition but cannot determine which channels drive conversions. Conversion rate stagnant at 1.8%. Cannot identify why users churn. Product team builds features based on intuition instead of data. Burned $30,000 on ineffective marketing by Month 12.

impact.product_development: Building wrong features, wasting engineering time
impact.marketing_efficiency: Spending on wrong channels, high CAC
impact.decision_making: Decisions based on anecdotes not data

warning_signs: Product decisions made without data backing
Cannot answer basic questions (which features drive retention?)

actions: Implement PostHog SDK across all platforms
Track key user actions: signup, event view, search, share
Implement conversion funnels: signup -> first event -> 7 days active -> paid
Set up cohort analysis for retention tracking
Define North Star Metric (Weekly Active Users or MRR)
Mandatory data backing for product decisions
A/B testing framework for features and pricing
Automated weekly reports for key stakeholders
mitigation_strategies.expected_impact: Decisions based on data not intuition

actions: UTM parameter strategy for all marketing
Channel attribution tracking (first touch, last touch, multi-touch)
In-app surveys for churn and satisfaction
Support ticket analysis for pain points

contingency_plan.trigger: Cannot answer critical business questions after Month 3
actions: Pause marketing spend until attribution clear
Hire data analyst if budget allows

success_metrics: Churn reasons identified for >80% of churned users
Marketing ROI by channel calculated weekly
Product decisions backed by data >90% of time

critical_business_risks.risk: Well-funded competitor enters market and outspends on acquisition
critical_business_risks.description: Established player (Yelp, Google, Facebook Events) or well-funded startup launches similar product and spends $500,000+ on user acquisition. Drives up CAC, makes growth prohibitively expensive. Cannot compete on marketing spend.
critical_business_risks.failure_scenario: Month 9: TikTok launches local events feature with massive marketing budget. Drives CAC from $3.00 to $6.00 overnight. Cannot afford to acquire users. Organic growth slows. Users flock to TikTok's free, network-effects-driven product. Market share erodes. Forced to pivot or shut down.

actions: Partner with local event organizers and venues
Unique value: authenticity vs algorithmic feeds
Become #1 in those cities before expanding
Deep integration with local culture and events
Expand only when dominant in existing markets
SEO for event discovery (Google search traffic)

mitigation_strategies.strategy: Build moat through data and community
actions: Event history and recommendations unique to platform
User investment in platform (saved events, preferences)

contingency_plan.trigger: Major competitor launches or CAC doubles
actions: Immediately niche down to most defensible markets
Cut paid acquisition by 50%, focus on retention

success_metrics: Strong brand recognition in core markets

critical_business_risks.risk: Product-market fit never achieved, users don't find value
critical_business_risks.description: Despite good execution, users don't find sufficient value in What's Poppin!. Retention remains low (<5% at Day 30), engagement minimal, word-of-mouth weak. App becomes 'nice to have' not 'must have'. Cannot achieve sustainable growth.
critical_business_risks.failure_scenario: Month 12: After 12 months of development, Day 30 retention stuck at 4%. Users download app, browse once or twice, then never return. Survey shows users say 'it's fine but I don't need it.' Word-of-mouth non-existent. Growth plateaus at 5,000 users. Cannot raise Series A due to weak engagement metrics.
warning_signs: Users cannot articulate core value prop
Feature usage scattered, no clear winner

mitigation_strategies.strategy: Intensive customer development before and during launch
actions: Identify and validate core use cases
Test value proposition with target users
Iterate on core features based on feedback
mitigation_strategies.expected_impact: High confidence in PMF before launch

actions: Measure impact on retention and engagement
Kill features that don't move metrics
Achieve >10% Day 30 retention before scaling marketing
Onboarding optimization (aha moment in first session)

mitigation_strategies.strategy: Niche down if broad market doesn't work
actions: Become 10x solution for niche vs 2x for everyone
Expand from beachhead market once dominant
mitigation_strategies.expected_impact: Strong PMF in niche enables expansion

actions: Identify if pivot needed or feature gaps
Consider pivoting to B2B (white-label for venues)
If no path forward, consider acquihire or shutdown

success_metrics: Users can articulate value prop clearly

high_priority_risks.risk: Data privacy regulations create compliance burden
high_priority_risks.description: GDPR, CCPA, or new privacy regulations require expensive compliance measures. Location data handling scrutinized. Potential fines or service restrictions.
mitigation_strategies: Minimize data collection to essential only
Implement GDPR compliance (consent, right to deletion)

high_priority_risks.risk: Event discovery highly seasonal, revenue volatile
high_priority_risks.description: User engagement drops 40-60% during off-season (winter, non-festival months). Revenue volatile, difficult to plan.
mitigation_strategies: Build year-round use cases (indoor events, winter activities)
Plan for seasonal cash flow with 6-month runway

high_priority_risks.risk: Spam, fake events, inappropriate content damages trust
high_priority_risks.description: User-generated event content includes spam, scams, or inappropriate listings. Trust erodes, users abandon platform.

high_priority_risks.risk: Key team member departure disrupts operations
high_priority_risks.description: Co-founder or key engineer leaves due to burnout, better offer, or disagreement. Massive disruption to product development and operations.
mitigation_strategies: Proper equity vesting (4 years with 1-year cliff)
Document all critical systems and processes
Regular team feedback and morale checks

high_priority_risks.risk: Unable to raise Series A, run out of runway
high_priority_risks.description: Market conditions poor, metrics not strong enough for Series A. Seed funding runs out at Month 18-24. Forced shutdown or acquihire.
mitigation_strategies: Achieve profitability or break-even by Month 24
Maintain 6-12 months runway at all times
Hit Series A milestones: $100K ARR, >10% retention, strong growth
Consider revenue-based financing or venture debt as bridge

medium_priority_risks.risk: Manual operations don't scale, operational burden increases
Security breach exposes user data, destroys trust
mitigation_strategies: Encryption at rest and in transit

medium_priority_risks.risk: Market not ready for product, too early or too late
mitigation_strategies: Validate market timing with customer interviews
Be prepared to pivot if timing wrong

key_recommendations: Implement aggressive cost monitoring and optimization from day 1
Focus on retention and product-market fit before scaling marketing
Build cloud-agnostic architecture to avoid vendor lock-in
Maintain 6-12 months runway buffer at all times
Niche down to defensible markets before broad expansion
Achieve break-even or profitability by Month 24 to reduce fundraising risk
Invest in performance monitoring and optimization early
Build sustainable organic growth channels (40-60% target)
Implement comprehensive analytics and data-driven decision making
Prepare contingency plans for top 7 critical risks
success_indicators: Series A milestones hit (>$100K ARR, strong growth)
Zero critical performance or security incidents
